casebody.data:
TEXAS & P. RY. CO. v. HOWELL. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. December 11, 1911.) No. 2,213. In Error to the Circuit Court of the United States for the Eastern District of Texas. F. H. Prendergast, for plaintiff in error'. S. P. Jones, for defendant in error.

Before PARDEE and SHELBY, Circuit Judges, and GRUBB, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

On the evidence this case was properly submitted to a jury. The instructions given to' the jury cover the case, and they are, so far as attacked in this court, free from reversible error. Necessarily the judgment of the Circuit Court is affirmed.
